Package pl.put.poznan.checker.model

Class Step

java.lang.Object
pl.put.poznan.checker.model.Step
All Implemented Interfaces:
Visitable
public class Step extends Object implements Visitable
Class representing a single step of a Scenario. It can contain the information about the actor performing the step, keyword present in the step, action taken in the step and the level of the step, meaning what step is, if counted linearly as well as depth of the step in case of subscenarios. As a means of implementing subscenarios each step can contain substeps represented in a form of an ArrayList. The class is an implementation of the Visitable interface and part of the Visitor design pattern

  • Constructor Details

    • Step

      public Step(String actor, String keyword, String action, ArrayList<Step> substeps, String stepLevel)
      Constructs a new Step object with the specified actor, keyword, action, substeps, and step level.
      Parameters:
      actor - String the actor performing the step
      keyword - String the keyword associated with the step
      action - String the action performed in the step
      substeps - ArrayList of Step an ArrayList of Step objects representing the substeps of this step
      stepLevel - String the level of this step in the hierarchy of steps. Written in the form like for example: "3.5.1.2".

    • Step

      public Step(Step step)
      Constructor for the Step Class, taking step class instance as an argument. Created for the purposes of creating a deep copy of an object.
      Parameters:
      step - Step taken as an argument, presumably to be copied.

    • getStepLevel

      public String getStepLevel()
      Returns stepLevel representing both the order of the step determined linearly and depth of the step.
      Returns:
      stepLevel - String representing the order and depth of the step written in the format like for example: "1.3.5" showing in this example the depth of 3 and the 5th step as substep of 3 which is a substep of step 1.

    • setStepLevel

      public void setStepLevel(String stepLevel)
      Sets StepLevel representing both the order and the depth of a Step.
      Parameters:
      stepLevel - String representing the order and depth of the step * written in the format like for example: "1.3.5" showing in this example * the depth of 3 and the 5th step as substep * of 3 which is a substep of step 1.

    • setSubsteps

      public void setSubsteps(ArrayList<Step> substeps)
      Sets Substeps for the present Step.
      Parameters:
      substeps - ArrayList of Step objects
